rundown: 4-1 W vs Pittsburgh Pirates Chris Sale: 5.2 innings, 1 earned run, 4 hits, 0 HR, 9 strikeouts Batters: Ronald Acuña Jr. (1 hits - 4 AB, 1 HR, 2 RBI) Matt Olson (2 hits - 3 AB, 1 RBI) The Braves secured a solid victory against the Pittsburgh Pirates, showcasing strong pitching and timely hitting. Chris Sale delivered an impressive performance on the mound, striking out 9 batters and allowing only 1 earned run over 5.2 innings. Key highlights include: 1. Ronald Acuña Jr. hit a crucial home run, contributing 2 RBIs and scoring a run himself. 2. Matt Olson had a productive day at the plate with 2 hits and an RBI. 3. The Braves' defense held the Pirates to just 1 run, maintaining control throughout the game.
